text: Jacobsen syndrome, or the 11q deletion syndrome, is a genetic mutation caused by the deletion of certain genes on chromosome 11. The number of deleted genes can total anywhere from 5 million to 16 million pairs of a person's DNA. ==Effects== The effects of Jacobsen include brain development issues, unique facial features, and often a bleeding disorder called the Paris-Trousseau syndrome. ==References== Category:Syndromes Category:Blood disorders Category:Genetic disorders
title: Jacobsen syndrome
